result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Striepling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Michelle A. or Arthur D.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Write letters of apology to Michelle M. and Arthur D.
Any other conditions deemed appropriate by Agent.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) - to be released for work and school.
LAST 30 DAYS STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.
Agent to determine the stayed Condition time to be served with or without non working hours.
Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 08:00 p.m. on 01-08-2016.

Defendant Michael A Striepling in court with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
